intro: Dorstenia thikaensis, commonly known as the East African false fig, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that resemble the shape of a boat or a drum. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
